comments_since_last_sample.body: Ive never even heard of "green cardamom". I asked my elderly mother if she had and she hadnt either. ...interesting that its just not that common where im from, or whatever.

can you guys cover Matsutake mushroom? I wonder why this mushroom gets quite pricy in Asian countries.

So basically it is so expensive because The market deems it like that by having those “high quality” standards that make farmers throw away completely good and edible cardamom, right? It struck me because where I live in Colombia, I can get cardamom so easily and its so cheap! However I would agree with the video as only about 30% of the cardamom I normally get, meets the criteria (big, green and closed) that the market demands. 

Pro tip: Cardamom is such a great vegan substitute for chewing gum. It’s freshness leaves a hit of sweet mint to the breath!

Cardamom and Black pepper are native(Orgin) species of state of Kerala, a tropical place. It will not grow in the US or in the Europe.  However, It can grow in South East Asia,  Africa and in South American climate.
